intro: Casparya multangula var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth caspary, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to a variety of environmental conditions. Its leaves are smooth and lack the hairy texture found in other varieties of Casparya. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
